ApiResources.Fields.Name: Name
ApiResources.Fields.Name.Hint: The unique name of the API. This value is used for authentication with introspection and will be added to the audience of the outgoing access token.
ApiResources.Fields.Name.Required: Please provide a api resource name.
ApiResources.Fields.DisplayName.Hint: This value can be used e.g. on the consent screen.
ApiResources.Fields.Description.Hint: This value can be used e.g. on the consent screen.
ApiResources.Fields.Enabled.Hint: Indicates if this resource is enabled and can be requested. Defaults to true.
ApiResources.Fields.UserClaims.Hint: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the access token.
Common.PickerSearchResultTitle: Search result: (click on the item to select)
ApiResource.ApiSecrets.Hint: The API secret is used for the introspection endpoint. The API can authenticate with introspection using the API name and secret.
ApiResourceScope.Fields.Name: Name
ApiResourceScope.Added: The scope has been added successfully.
ApiResourceScope.Deleted: The scope has been deleted successfully.
ApiScope.Fields.Name: Name
ApiScope.Fields.Name.Hint: The unique name of the API. This value is used for authentication with introspection and will be added to the audience of the outgoing access token.
ApiScope.Fields.DisplayName.Hint: This value can be used e.g. on the consent screen.
ApiScope.Fields.Description.Hint: This value can be used e.g. on the consent screen.
ApiScope.Fields.Required.Hint: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Defaults to false.
ApiScope.Fields.Emphasize.Hint: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes. Defaults to false.
IdentityResource.Fields.Name: Name
IdentityResource.Fields.Name.Hint: The unique name of the identity resource. This is the value a client will use for the scope parameter in the authorize request.
IdentityResource.Fields.DisplayName.Hint: This value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
IdentityResource.Fields.Description.Hint: This value will be used e.g. on the consent screen.
IdentityResource.Fields.Enabled.Hint: Indicates if this resource is enabled and can be requested. Defaults to true.
IdentityResource.Fields.ShowInDiscoveryD: Specifies whether this scope is shown in the discovery document. Defaults to true.
IdentityResource.Fields.Required.Hint: Specifies whether the user can de-select the scope on the consent screen (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Defaults to false.
IdentityResource.Fields.Emphasize.Hint: Specifies whether the consent screen will emphasize this scope (if the consent screen wants to implement such a feature). Use this setting for sensitive or important scopes. Defaults to false.
IdentityResource.Fields.UserClaims.Hint: List of associated user claim types that should be included in the identity token.

ApiResourceSecret.Added: The new api secret resource has been added successfully.
ApiResourceSecret.Deleted: The api secret resource has been deleted successfully.
ApiResourceProperty.Key.Required: Please provide a api property key.
ApiResourceProperty.Value.Required: Please provide a api property value.
Clients.ClientName.Hint: Client display name (used for logging and consent screen)
Clients.Enabled.Hint: Specifies if client is enabled. Defaults to true.
Clients.RequireClientSecret.Hint: Specifies whether this client needs a secret to request tokens from the token endpoint (defaults to true)
Clients.RequirePkce.Hint: Specifies whether clients using an authorization code based grant type must send a proof key (defaults to true).
Clients.AllowPlainTextPkce.Hint: Specifies whether clients using PKCE can use a plain text code challenge (not recommended - and default to false)
Clients.AllowOfflineAccess.Hint: Specifies whether this client can request refresh tokens (be requesting the offline_access scope)
Clients.AllowAccessTokensViaBrowser.Hint: Specifies whether this client is allowed to receive access tokens via the browser. This is useful to harden flows that allow multiple response types (e.g. by disallowing a hybrid flow client that is supposed to use code id_token to add the token response type and thus leaking the token to the browser.
Clients.AllowedScopes.Hint: By default a client has no access to any resources - specify the allowed resources by adding the corresponding scopes names
Clients.AllowedGrantTypes.Hint: Specifies the grant types the client is allowed to use. Use the GrantTypes class for common combinations.
Clients.ClientSecrets.Hint: List of client secrets - credentials to access the token endpoint.
Clients.Properties.Hint: Dictionary to hold any custom client-specific values as needed.
Clients.FrontChannelLogoutUri.Hint: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP based front-channel logout. See the OIDC Front-Channel spec for more details.
Clients.FrontChannelLogoutSessionRequire: Specifies if the user’s session id should be sent to the FrontChannelLogoutUri. Defaults to true.
Clients.BackChannelLogoutUri.Hint: Specifies logout URI at client for HTTP based back-channel logout. See the OIDC Back-Channel spec for more details.
Clients.BackChannelLogoutSessionRequired: Specifies if the user’s session id should be sent in the request to the BackChannelLogoutUri. Defaults to true.
Clients.EnableLocalLogin.Hint: Specifies if this client can use local accounts, or external IdPs only. Defaults to true.
Clients.PostLogoutRedirectUris.Hint: Specifies allowed URIs to redirect to after logout. See the OIDC Connect Session Management spec for more details.
Clients.IdentityProviderRestrictions.Hin: Specifies which external IdPs can be used with this client (if list is empty all IdPs are allowed). Defaults to empty.
Clients.UserSsoLifetime.Hint: The maximum duration (in seconds) since the last time the user authenticated. Defaults to null. You can adjust the lifetime of a session token to control when and how often a user is required to reenter credentials instead of being silently authenticated, when using a web application.
Clients.RequireConsent.Hint: Specifies whether a consent screen is required. Defaults to false.
Clients.AllowRememberConsent.Hint: Specifies whether user can choose to store consent decisions. Defaults to true.
Clients.ClientUri.Hint: URI to further information about client (used on consent screen)
Clients.LogoUri.Hint: URI to client logo (used on consent screen)
Clients.UserCodeType.Hint: Specifies the type of user code to use for the client. Otherwise falls back to default.
Clients.DeviceCodeLifetime.Hint: Lifetime to device code in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)
Clients.Claims.Hint: Allows settings claims for the client (will be included in the access token).
Clients.IdentityTokenLifetime.Hint: Lifetime to identity token in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)
Clients.AccessTokenLifetime.Hint: Lifetime of access token in seconds (defaults to 3600 seconds / 1 hour)
Clients.AccessTokenType.Hint: Specifies whether the access token is a reference token or a self contained JWT token (defaults to Jwt).
Clients.AuthorizationCodeLifetime.Hint: Lifetime of authorization code in seconds (defaults to 300 seconds / 5 minutes)
Clients.AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime.Hin: Maximum lifetime of a refresh token in seconds. Defaults to 2592000 seconds / 30 days
Clients.SlidingRefreshTokenLifetime.Hint: Sliding lifetime of a refresh token in seconds. Defaults to 1296000 seconds / 15 days
Clients.RefreshTokenUsage.Hint: ReUse the refresh token handle will stay the same when refreshing tokens.  OneTime the refresh token handle will be updated when refreshing tokens. This is the default.
Clients.RefreshTokenExpiration.Hint: Absolute the refresh token will expire on a fixed point in time (specified by the AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime)  Sliding when refreshing the token, the lifetime of the refresh token will be renewed (by the amount specified in SlidingRefreshTokenLifetime). The lifetime will not exceed AbsoluteRefreshTokenLifetime.
Clients.AllowedCorsOrigins.HInt: If specified, will be used by the default CORS policy service implementations (In-Memory and EF) to build a CORS policy for JavaScript clients.
Clients.UpdateAccessTokenClaimsOnRefresh: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the access token (and its claims) should be updated on a refresh token request.
Clients.IncludeJwtId.Hint: Specifies whether JWT access tokens should have an embedded unique ID (via the jti claim). Defaults to true.
Clients.AlwaysSendClientClaims.Hint: If set, the client claims will be sent for every flow. If not, only for client credentials flow (default is false)
Clients.AlwaysIncludeUserClaimsInIdToken: When requesting both an id token and access token, should the user claims always be added to the id token instead of requiring the client to use the userinfo endpoint. Default is false.
Clients.ClientClaimsPrefix.Hint: If set, the prefix client claim types will be prefixed with. Defaults to client_. The intent is to make sure they don’t accidentally collide with user claims.
Clients.PairWiseSubjectSalt.Hint: Salt value used in pair-wise subjectId generation for users of this client.

Roles.Fields.SystemName.Required: Please provide a scope name and it should be unique.
Users.Fields.Name: Name
Users.Fields.Email.Required: Please provide a email or the email format is incorrect.
Users.Fields.Password.Equal: The password shoule be equal to confirm password.
